reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening the national response for the control of Tuberculosis and supporting the strengthening of the health system in Angola

description.narrative: Angola - Tuberculosis - Ministry of Health of the Republic of Angola - MOH. This program has the following goals: Reduce maternal mortality and infant and child mortality. Reduce morbidity and mortality from Tuberculosis. The objectives of this program are: Objective 1: Detect 85% of bacteriologically positive new TB cases. Objective 4: Improve the national health system through resource allocation in order to increase the efficiency and the quality of health services. Objective 2: Achieve 85% TB treatment success rate among bacteriologically confirmed cases. Objective 3: Improve TB monitoring and evaluation systems, aligning information records in 100% of provinces. Objective 5: Increase the proportion of TB patients tested for HIV from 25% to 70%

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for AGO-T-MOH
Percentage of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings
TCP-3: Number of notified cases of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapses
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment

TCP-other 1: Treatment success rate- bacteriologically confirmed: Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed TB cases successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among the bacteriologically confirmed TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
PSM-other 2: Proportion of health facilities reporting no stock-outs of RDT during the reporting period (MALARIA)
PSM-other 1: Proportion of health facilities reporting no stock-outs of ACT during the reporting period (MALARIA)
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Percentage of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB started on treatment for MDR-TB who were lost to follow up during the first six months of treatment
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
PSM-other 3: Percentage of health facilities reporting no stock-outs of anti-TB drug ( 4 FDC) on the last day of the quarter (TB)
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Percentage of reporting units reporting no stock-outs of anti-TB drugs on the last day of the quarter
